oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage about schools in Nashville in the 1800's. Nashville Banner, 1928 December 9.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Wright, John L.; Hailey, T. W.; Clemons, Emma B.; Brown, V. H.; Lipscomb, J. F.; Bailey, J. E.; Cavert, A. J.; Johns, D. J.; Ferrell, W. H.; Manlove, W. R.; Jones, R. W.; Ross, M. M.; Weber, H. C.
Nashville Banner
Group portraits; Musicians; Education; Schools
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage about schools in Nashville in the 1800's. Images include a group photo of school heads and pictures of Fogg High and Hume Schools, Ninth Ward School, Howard School, Main Street School, and Hynes School. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.

oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
